===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=せいしんふんれつひょう|精神|tr1=seishin|t1=mind, intellect; psyche|分裂|tr2=bunretsu|t2=split; break apart|病|tr3=byō|t3=disease, sickness, illness}}. Coined in Japan in the [[w:Meiji period|Meiji period]] as a translation of {{etyl|de|ja|sort=せいしんぶんれつびょう}} {{m|de|Schizophrenie}}.

The Japanese term {{m|ja|精神|tr=seishin||mind}} has overtones of {{m|en|reason}} or {{m|en|intellect}} in ordinary use, leading historically to some confusion regarding this diagnosis, as persons with schizophrenia do not necessarily exhibit any breakdown of intellect. The confusion ultimately led the Japanese Society of Psychiatry and Neurology to formally relabel the disease in 2002 as {{m|ja|統合失調症|tr=tōgō shitchō shō|lit=comprehensive disharmony/imbalance disorder}}.
